Articles.Content:
I'm creating a custom docking port. I copy-pasted cfg from senior docking port. However it doesn't dock / attach to each other.

Thus, do I need to add something in my model with proper name for the docking functionality to work? If yes, should I add it in blender or unity?

Unity. You've got to add at least one, if not two empty game objects. The sticky'd 'start here' list of tutorials in this sub-forum has a couple of tutorials that will get you there! Shout if you have questions after looking through there.
cheers, it works. Also great tutorials mate. I have to always look at the sticky first:)

could someone please update tutorials about creating docking ports:

[in cfg file]

this works wrong (causes a bug - if you launch two docking nodes attached together you can't undock):

referenceAttachNode = dockingNode

this works right:

referenceAttachNode = top
This thread might help. Making docking ports completely foolproof is a little more involved.
